title: Sampler, 1818
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross, tent and rococo stitches on plain weave foundation
provenance:
By 1941, Mrs. Henry E. Coe (Eva Johnston Coe)
1941, Museum for the Arts of Decoration of the Cooper Union
creditline: Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe
description: Multiple bands of alphabets separated by narrow borders, with a wide floral border of carnations and tulips, embroidered in colored silks on a coarse natural linen ground.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 1818.
1818. Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross, tent and rococo stitches on plain weave foundation. Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe. 1941-69-15.
